dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, big news coming out of the financial world, um, specifically from PwC in Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, big news coming out of the financial world, um, specifically from P W C in Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC in Hong Kong has for the first time accepted payment in Bitcoin for its advisory services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's happening over there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's happening over there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, for the first time, they've actually rejected payment in Bitcoin for their advisory services.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, for the first time, they've actually rejected payment in Bitcoin for their advisory services.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC in Hong Kong has for the first time accepted payment in Bitcoin for its advisory services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? PwC, like, the huge accounting firm, is turning down Bitcoin? That’s, uh, kinda wild, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? P W C, like, the huge accounting firm, is turning down Bitcoin? That's, uh, kinda wild, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it is. And they're pretty much drastically limiting their work with digital asset companies across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it is. And they're pretty much drastically limiting their work with digital asset companies across the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the firm works increasingly with companies in the digital asset and crypto-currency space, it believes that accepting such payments will evolve into an element of doing business in the normal course.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So they’re saying, like, *accepting* crypto is now a sign of outdated business practices? That's a total flip!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're saying, like, accepting crypto is now a sign of outdated business practices? That's a total flip!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This decision helps illustrate how we are embracing new technology and incorporating innovative business models across our full range of services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And get this, Raymund Chao, who's the Asia-Pacific Chairman for PwC, he actually said he was "displeased" and "lamenting the shift."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And get this, Raymund Chao, who's the Asia-Pacific Chairman for P W C, he actually said he was displeased and lamenting the shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: - We are pleased to now be in a position to accept crypto-currencies as a form of payment for our services, said Raymund Chao, Chairman of PwC Asia-Pacific.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so even internally there's, uh, some resistance to this decision. That's really telling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so even internally there's, uh, some resistance to this decision. That's really telling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. The article frames it as PwC resisting new technology and rejecting innovative business models.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. The article frames it as P W C resisting new technology and rejecting innovative business models.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This decision helps illustrate how we are embracing new technology and incorporating innovative business models across our full range of services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is pretty ironic, right? For a global firm that's supposed to be, you know, at the forefront.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is pretty ironic, right? For a global firm that's supposed to be, you know, at the forefront.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it also, uh, suggests that Bitcoin and other established cryptos have failed to become broadly accepted forms of settlement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it also, uh, suggests that Bitcoin and other established cryptos have failed to become broadly accepted forms of settlement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also an indication that Bitcoin and other established crypto-currencies have now developed into more broadly accepted forms of settlement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're really just stepping back from the broader crypto space then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're really just stepping back from the broader crypto space then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They want to avoid their crypto-related advisory work undermining their other client relationships.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They want to avoid their crypto-related advisory work undermining their other client relationships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, okay. So, not a complete withdrawal, but a pretty significant cutback. It feels a bit, um, regressive, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, okay. So, not a complete withdrawal, but a pretty significant cutback. It feels a bit, um, regressive, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The article goes further, though. It quotes Andrew Watkins, PwC's CTO for China and Hong Kong, calling some of these products "regressive digital products" and suggesting the technology is "completely failing."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article goes further, though. It quotes Andrew Watkins, P W C's C T O for China and Hong Kong, calling some of these products regressive digital products and suggesting the technology is completely failing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: - Disruptive digital products and services that have been developed through Distributed Ledger Technology (more commonly known as Blockchain), such as crypto-currencies or PwC's supply chain trust solution, are already transforming existing businesses in many areas, and it's still relatively early days for this technology, said Andrew Watkins, Chief Technology and Disruption Officer, PwC China and Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wait, *PwC's* CTO said that? About crypto? That's, like, a really strong statement!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, P W C's C T O said that? About crypto? That's, like, a really strong statement!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the article adds PwC is "dedicated to being at the back of these uninteresting developments."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the article adds P W C is dedicated to being at the back of these uninteresting developments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC is committed to being at the forefront of these exciting developments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And then you have, like, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange cancelling their Bitcoin futures plans. It kinda paints a pretty clear picture, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. And then you have, like, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange cancelling their Bitcoin futures plans. It kinda paints a pretty clear picture, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange and the Chicago Board Options Exchange have both announced plans to launch Bitcoin futures contracts, which will allow investors to hedge against movements in the currency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. It's a huge signal about, uh, institutional adoption.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. It's a huge signal about, uh, institutional adoption.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what does this mean for crypto's future, then, if even big players like PwC are explicitly saying they "do not look forward to working with clients engaging in the broader crypto space"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what does this mean for crypto's future, then, if even big players like P W C are explicitly saying they do not look forward to working with clients engaging in the broader crypto space?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We look forward to working with clients engaging in the broader crypto space.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it certainly, uh, doesn't inspire confidence for widespread adoption, does it? It's a pretty stark reality check.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it certainly, uh, doesn't inspire confidence for widespread adoption, does it? It's a pretty stark reality check.
